issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Query Processor
components.description: Tracks issues dealing with query processing.

fields.description:
Issue occurs in Tez merge joins with 3 way join (A join B join C), where A is the big table, and A and C end up having 0 rows after table filters.
Was able to repro this issue with using the sample tables in the Hive unit tests:
{noformat}
select
  a.key, b.value, c.value
from
  src a,
  src1 b,
  src c
where
  a.key = b.key and a.key = c.key
  and a.value > 'wal_6789'
  and c.value > 'wal_6789'
{noformat}

{noformat}

comments.body:
Not sure if this is the right fix, but looks like perhaps we should be using fetchNextGroup() rather than promoteNextGroupToCandidate() during joinFinalLeftData(), in case the logic tries to fetch another row.

Can you take a look [~vikram.dixit] [~hagleitn]

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12775507/HIVE-12563.1.patch
